alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 1:38AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, north central Nicholas, southwestern Braxton, southeastern Roane and northeastern Clay Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 138 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Big Otter, or 10 miles north of Clay, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sutton, Gassaway, Birch River, Big Otter, Wallback, Harrison, Flatwoods, Nebo, Frametown, Strange Creek, Wilsie, Servia, Little Birch, Ivydale, Nicut and Chloe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 32 and 67, and between mile markers 69 and 70. Route 19 between mile markers 59 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
